intro: Isolepis hirtella, commonly known as hairy spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescence composed of small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Isolepis hirtella plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
